From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display only map-class configuration information from the running configuration file, use the **show running-config map-class** command in privileged EXEC mode.
CLIs: show running-config map-class [ atm [ <map-class-name> ] | dialer [ <map-class-name> ] | frame-relay [ <map-class-name> ] ] [ linenum ]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Displays only ATM map-class configuration lines.
(Optional) Displays only dialer map-class configuration lines.
(Optional) Displays only Frame Relay map-class configuration lines.
(Optional) Displays only configuration lines for the specified map-class.
(Optional) Displays line numbers in the output.

Examples: All Map Classes Configured on the Router Example
The following example displays all map classes configured on the router:
All Frame Relay Map Classes Example
The following example displays all Frame Relay map classes on the router:
A Specific Map Class and Display of Line Numbers Example
The following example displays a specific map class called class1. Line numbers are displayed in the output.
Router# show running-config map-class frame-relay class1 linenum
ExtraInfo: Use the **show running-config map-class** command to display the following information from the running configuration file:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif) All map classes configured on the router.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif) Map classes configured specifically for ATM, Frame Relay, or dialer.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif) A specific ATM, Frame Relay, or dialer map class.Use the **linenum** keyword to display line numbers in the output. This option is useful for identifying a particular portion of a very large configuration.

RelatedCmds.description: Specifies the ATM map class for an SVC.
Defines a class of shared configuration parameters associated with the dialer map command for outgoing calls from an ISDN interface and for PPP callback.
Specifies a map class to define QoS values for a Frame Relay VC.
Displays contents of the currently running configuration file (equivalent to the **show running-config** command.)
